actions.text: QUESTION OF THE PRIVILEGES OF THE HOUSE - Mr. Thomas of California rose to a question of the privileges of the House and submitted H. Res. 519 for immediate consideration as a privileged matter. The Chair ruled that the resolution constituted a question of the privileges of the House and qualified for consideration.
Mr. Rose moved to table the measure.
On motion to table the measure Agreed to by recorded vote: 233 - 176 (Roll no. 293).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Relating to the privileges of the House.

summary.text: Directs the Committee on Standards of Official Conduct to: (1) investigate violations of the Agreement of Confidentiality of the Committee on House Administration Task Force to Investigate the Operation and Management of the Office of the Postmaster; and (2) determine whether the conduct of any task force Member who attempted to influence the content of the final task force report by calling any Member not on the task force regarding confidential information in the draft report violated House rule XLIII (the Code of Official Conduct).

titles.title: Relating to the privileges of the House.
